title: Executive Order 8483-Exemption of Louis Loebl From Compulsory Retirement for Age
content: Whereas, in my judgment, the public interest requires that Louis Loebl, special agent, Federal Bureau of Investigation, Department of Justice, who, during the month of September, 1940, will reach the retirement age prescribed for automatic separation from the service, applicable to him, be exempted from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year:

Now, Therefore, by virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932, 47 Stat. 382, 404 (U.S.C., title 5, sec. 715a), I hereby exempt the said Louis Loebl from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year ending September 30, 1941.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8483-Exemption of Louis Loebl From Compulsory Retirement for Age Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/210352
